com.hybris.cis.common.ws

Class MarshallingWebServiceMessageCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hybris.cis.common.ws.MarshallingWebServiceMessageCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.ws.client.core.WebServiceMessageCallback

    public class MarshallingWebServiceMessageCallback
extends Object
implements org.springframework.ws.client.core.WebServiceMessageCallback

    A WebServiceMessageCallback that marshalls an object to the web service messages payload and logs the output to a specific logger.

    By default, Spring logs all WebServiceTemplate requests to to org.springframework.ws.client.MessageTracing. So you cannot for example use different log categories for different web services. This call-back provides for this.

    To use this callback simply pass it to the web service template: webServiceTemplate.sendAndReceive(uri, myRequestCallback, myResponseCallback);

    • Constructor Detail

      • MarshallingWebServiceMessageCallback

        public MarshallingWebServiceMessageCallback(org.springframework.oxm.Marshaller marshaller,
                                            org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                            Substituter substitutor,
                                            Object payload)
        Instantiates a new log web service message callback.
        Parameters:
        marshaller - The marshaller used to serialize the payload object
        logger - The logger to use to log the serialized payload
        substitutor - A substitutor used to substitute certain strings (e.g. to mask passwords), pass null to not perform any substitutions
        payload - The payload object to serialize
